body.name: Altra Men's Paradigm 6 Road Running Shoe
features: Go Further: Our GuideRail guidance system provides extra medial support when you need it most and our FootShape toe boxes allow toes to splay for natural foot positioning and comfort
Stay Comfortable: The updated Innovarch arch feature encourages better foot placement in each step and the Altra EGO Max cushioned midsoles are light, luxurious and responsive
Push Yourself: Balanced Cushioning places your heel and forefoot the same distance from the ground to encourage proper, low-impact form throughout your run
Stay Focused: 30 mm stack height provides ample cushion for long runs

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #29,351 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry) #146 in Men's Road Running Shoes

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: PARADIGM 6 | BLURRING THE LINE The first Altra shoe inspired by and developed with an Altra athlete. Meet the Paradigm 6, a shoe that is blurring the line between support shoe and everyday trainer. Altra Elite Athlete and two-time Olympian Kara Goucher’s input helped us take this shoe to the next level, adding an Altra EGO MAX midsole and slimming down the overall design while maintaining its key support features. BALANCED CUSHIONING Our Balanced Cushioning platform positions your heel and forefoot at an equal distance from the ground, encouraging better alignment, better form, and a low impact landing. INNERFLEX These grid-like grooves in the midsole are designed to provide flexibility and movement. GUIDERAIL The GuideRail acts like a supportive highway guide rail that encourages natural foot placement by provides guidance, but only when it’s needed.

Paradigm 6 Torin 6 Escalante 3 Rivera 2 Provision 6 Outsole FootPod FootPod FootPod FootPod FootPod Weight (oz) 10.8 9.9 9.3 8.8 10.1 Cushion Max High Moderate Moderate High Stack Height (mm) 30 28 24 26 28 Innerflex ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

OUR BRAND Altra Running was founded on an innovative approach to running shoes. An approach that took us from the back room of a specialty running store to the front of the pack on roads and trails across the world. With innovation at our forefront, our founders created our first shoe with the help of a toaster oven. This was the start of our signature shoe construction to help you move naturally and has kept our brand going for a decade while aiming to keep you running. OUR PURPOSE Unleashing human potential by inspiring the world to move naturally is what Altra Running is all about. Our purpose is built around discovery, joy, responsibility, natural movement, and finding your potential. OUR INNOVATION Our wide-lacing system inspired our signature FootShape design to encourage natural movement. While a household toaster oven inspired our founders, FootShape and Balanced Cushioning has inspired thousands of people to unleash their human potential. That’s the foundation of Altra Running: innovative, disruptive thinking.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality shoe. Lightweight and comfortable without sacrificing comfort and stability.
reviews.reviewText: So this is going to be an extensive review. I usually wear orthotics due to one foot with a high arch and the other is almost being flat. I walk/run between 60 and 110 miles each week. Most running shoes have a pointed toe box. Not the Paradigm 6. The roomy toe box is extremely comfortable. It's the most comfortable shoe I have ever warn. I put in crazy miles and tend to pronate. This leads to hip pain and eventually knee pain. My maiden Trek with these shoes was 10.6 miles. I felt great afterwards. Normally my feet are after a 10 miler. Not the case. I did not wear any orthotics. I did feel a little hip pain during cool down, so I will be putting high arch orthotics in for next outing. Having two different arches affects the mechanics of the hips and the knees. Moving on to the heel. The sits nicely, almost like it is sitting in a cup. There is superb ankle support. I took the shoe over some rocky terrain and my ankles always felt secure. I don't like lacing my shoes tight. I use a slipper spoon to to get into my shoes. Even so my foot did not shift once.I would recommend these shoes to anyone looking for high performance and light weight without sacrificing comfort and stability. I don't right many reviews, but these shoes are worthy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful walking shoe!
reviews.reviewText: Great fit with anatomical sized toe box. Nice cushioned stable support. I’ll definitely order again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I don't 'Run' but do cardio and weights in these shoes. Due to nerve damage, shoes feel very weird on my foot. Having zero lift and a VERY wide toe box makes these shoes feel very 'normal' and I lover the support. These are running shoes so lateral movements are not well supported but running, Stairmaster, elliptical and weights are great. HOWEVER - the new list prices from ALTRA are bordering on ridiculous and they had better gets costs inline...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Almost, but not quite, great
reviews.reviewText: Runner for more years than I care to admit, and have tried them all (even tried no shoes at all). Wide feet have I, and injured my fair share, so my go-tos were Brooks or New Balance. But a wise, “seasoned” running store employee said, “Try these.” And he fitted me w a pair of Altra Paradigm 6. Instantly sold. Cushy but not squishy (except when wet — more on that later). I need a bit of motion control and the Guide Rail structure keeps my ankles from pronating as much. Nice energy return, and that first pair lasted about 700 miles, which is a bit more than I expected. They are constructed such that the mesh area around the big toe doesn’t tear out (and yes, I keep my nails well-trimmed). So I bought this second pair at a good discount (that seems to have disappeared), and I have to say that I have never been happier with a running shoe, or the experience of running in them.Every rose has a thorn. And this one is simply that when they get wet, they stay wet. And when they get wet, they get squishy. Every shoe gets wet in the rain, but not every shoe gets squishy. I happen to create a lot of my own rain on long runs (ie, I sweat akin to a monsoon), so these shoes are regularly soaked through. Remove the inner footbed, stuff them with newspaper or paper towels, and give them at least a full day to dry.I do love these shoes, which surely means that Altra will screw around and modify them so the next iteration will suck and I’ll be on the shoe hunt once again. They’re not cheap, but if you value your runs (and do most of them under dry conditions), the wide toe box, and some nice spring in your stride, give them a try.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So comfortable and well made
reviews.reviewText: I’m so glad I discovered this brand of shoe. I bought my first pair on clearance while on a trip and they’re practically the only shoe I’ve worn the past 6 months. I love the color as well because it blends well with almost anything I wear.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit. So comfortable
reviews.reviewText: These are my 4th or 5th pair. I cannot recommend these more highly. They fit so comfortably. I used to have pain from running shoes that were made to look great and squeezed my toes. I even went to a podiatrist to try and get some relief. These shoes solved that problem.I run daily:2-5 miles per day. These shows last nearly 9 months. They are usable beyond that but for me, the tread wears to the point that traction is iffy in wet weather. I think the wear is no worse than other more uncomfortable shoes I have worn.I decided to get orange this time. Great color.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sole compromising too quickly
reviews.reviewText: Altra Men's Paradigm 6 Road Running Shoe - bought these in May for my husband for Christmas - he has worn them about two weeks and two of the black sole squares (one on each of the inside edges) are coming off. For the price, I don't believe being worn around the house and to do errands (no gym, no running, biking, etc) should compromise the integrity of the sole that fast. Comfort is fine, support is great especially in his toe box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really like these shoes and growing to love them….these are very comfortable, breathable, flexible and attractive….hmm, I like the orange…..wearing these often and they are comfortable. Update, these have taken 1st place from Hoka Clifton’s in my sneaker rating…primarily used as dog walkers….like walking on deep carpet….super plush ride, my favorite dog walker….I would compare these to the the Hoka Clifton, Saucony Triumph, ASICS M33….a 30mm stack front and back….wide toe area

reviews.reviewTitle: Fit is good. Price is good.
reviews.reviewText: fit is good, price is good, had to order twice--first order was undeliverable, second order successful
Excelente calidad. Gran comfort al trotar. Un poco más ancho de lo habitual

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 14, 2024

reviews.reviewText: da ich einen Hallux habe und viel Zehenfreiheit benötige, sind diese Schuhe perfekt. Nach einer Knie OP habe ich eine sehr weiche Dämpfung nötig. Diese Schuhe wurden mir empfohlen und für mich sind sie perfekt.
Buen material pero muy estrecha en el empeine por lo demás buenos acabados y terminación cómodas
